p: The average Arctic air concentrations of Hg 0, Reactive Gaseous Mercury (RGM = HgO + HgCl 2) and Total Particular Mercury (TPM = primary + oxidized particulate Hg) are shown in Figure 2 for the 1990s and the 2090s. The average concentration of Hg 0 is 4% higher in the 2090s compared to the 1990s, while the concentrations of both RGM and TPM are lower with 41% and 62%, respectively.
